Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)
= musical instrument with strings, such as a lute (כִּנֹּור) or lyre (נֵבֶל)

= the meaning of this word is uncertain and can only be deduced from its etymology; possible interpretations include: a song that shows understanding, by which the understanding either refers to the structure or to the contents of this song; or: a song that gives understanding; or: a meditation
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else
= action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness
= to try to win a favorable attitude from someone else; ◄ by approaching that person in a very humble way
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= process by which humans are shaken out of a state of complacency and routine, ◄ as a result of a certain event
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
literally: to cause to fall down; hence: = causative process by which humans cause events to happen to other humans
= state in which humans are suffering caused by difficult circumstances; ≈ often seen as the consequences of their own wickedness
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= state in which humans harbor resentment against (other) humans for things they did in the past
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to tremble|to be distressed|to be in anguish
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience strong fear and distress, ◄ compared to the state of mind of a woman in labor; ► often accompanied by physical side effects, like writhing, and trembling
= state of strong fear because of an actual or perceived danger, such as aggression from the enemy, a dangerous animal, or death
= process by which humans or animals stop living
literally: to fall (upon someone); hence: = process by which humans are affected by a certain condition, emotion, or supernatural influence
= state in which humans experience fear
= process by which the human body shakes, ◄ as a result of fear
literally: to cover; hence: = process by which certain events happen with a great intensity and are often more than the recipient can bear

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= part of the body ◄ of a bird, ► used for flying

= a bird with a blue gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering
= action by which a winged living creature moves through the air by flapping its wings
= action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous
= action when people or objects stay overnight in a certain place
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= causative action by which someone causes an event to happen speedily
= a place where humans find shelter

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing danger and destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare

Node.gloss: to swallow up|to destroy|to confuse|to confound|to frustrate
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities or humans cause other humans and objects to be removed from existence in a violent way, as if by swallowing up, either by direct intervention or by accomplishing this through the hands of others|exact meaning unsure; possibly: = causative action by which someone causes a mind event not to produce the expected outcome
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
literally: tongue; hence: = a system of communication used by a community, ethnic group, or nation

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= during the daytime
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= action by which humans move in a full or partial circle

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
= process by which events take place that cause damage, distress, hurt, and/or loss of life
literally: to detach itself (from a someone or somewhere); hence: = process by which a certain event stops taking place
= central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

Node.gloss: to reproach|to taunt|to insult|to defy|to blaspheme
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions
literally: to hold, carry; hence: = process by which humans undergo certain processes or actions initiated by (other) humans or deities
= person who experiences hostily towards someone else and acts accordingly

Node.gloss: to make oneself great|to show one's greatness|to magnify oneself
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities show others their elevated status, which they have, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= action by which humans go to a location where they will not be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= person, male or female, with whom one has a special bond, such as friendship, marriage, a covenant, etc., ≈ usually regarded with affection and seen as trustworthy
= person with whom someone is acquainted in an intimate way
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= state in which an event is pleasant
= intimate, close association with another person or deity or a group

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move through an area without a specific destination
= a relatively large group of people
read יַשִּׁי מָוֶת with ; see נשׁא (נשׁא) or שׁוא (שׁוא)|= action with which someone misleads or deceives another person
= abode of the dead; ≈ considered to be a remote place, deep in the earth, with power over humankind, without remembrance, without praising God

Node.gloss: to go down (to the netherworld)|to die
Node.definition: literally: to go down (to the netherworld, death, the pit, the dust, silence, etc.); hence: = process by which humans die and descend into the world of the dead

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering

= state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time|= state in which humans experience a strong fear that certain things might happen to them
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

= the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= the time of the day when the sun is at its highest point
= action by which humans produce inarticulate sounds expressing distress
= action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= armed conflict in which weapons are used to attack an enemy
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which humans or deities assume a position of leadership, ◄ as if sitting on an actual throne
literally: to bow down; hence: = causative action in which a humans or deities cause (other) humans to suffer hardship and trouble, ► resulting in a state of inability to help oneself
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= process of changing one's behavior

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to stretch out (one's) hand|to stretch out (one's) right hand|to lay (one's) hand
Node.definition: = action by which humans stretch out their hand, right hand, or finger in order to do point with it or to put it in position for another action

Node.gloss: to lay (one's) hands (on someone or something)
Node.definition: literally: to stretch out (one's) hand (against someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities engage in an act of violence against (other) humans
= action by which humans show total disrespect for a process that is considered holy and/or worthy of respect ◄ by words or actions that are not in line with the behavior that is associated with it
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
literally: to be smooth; hence: = state in which an event appears to be well intentioned, though actually being insincere

= coagulated substance; ◄ formed by action of acids on milk; ► made into cheese (חָרִיץ) or eaten as food; ≈ regarded as choice food and therefore often associated with prosperity; because of the smoothness of this substance it is sometimes associated with flattery and untrustworthiness as well
= an action by which humans and deities utter words, ◄ as coming from their mouths
= armed conflict in which weapons are used to attack an enemy
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
literally: opened sword; hence: = sword (חֶרֶב) that has been removed from its scabbard ► in order to harm someone else
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: a heavy load to be carried; hence: = a matter of concern that affects someone deeply; ◄ as if it were a heavy load
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
literally: to cause to contain; hence: = causative action by which humans, animals or deities ensure that (other) humans received the food and care that they need
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: to bring down|to cast down|to thrust down
Node.definition: literally: to cause to go down (to the netherworld, death, the pit, the dust, silence, etc.); hence: = causative process by which humans or deities cause humans to die and descend into the world of the dead

= naturally occurring depression, hole or pit, usually containing a substance in liquid form; ≈ a metaphor for death, based on the physical resemblance of a pit to a grave, on the danger of falling into a pit, or being drowned by water in it, and on the depth of a pit recalling the underworld place of the dead
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
literally: to divide (one's) days; hence: = process by which humans do not live longer than half the time that they would live otherwise
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
